page.title: 08FARMING IN CANFORD MAGNA.
page.content: In recent years some farms in the area have been replaced by housing estates, others are threatened.Active farming still takes place on 5 farms. {HIGHER MERLEY FARM}is owned by Rowe (property developers)who are seeking permission to build on theland.Manag- ed by Mr.A.Upshall,there are 70acres, 45cereal & 25 beef.Interestingly,it includes a lairage,an area where ani- mals are heldand cared for whilst awaiting export for breeding purposes. Here the animals were held before ex- port to the Falkland Isles to restock farms after the l982 war with Argent- ina.All except 1 survived the 8000 journey.It can take 500 sheep or 400 calves or 80 in-calf heifers.{CRUXTON {FARM}85acres of enriched grassland,is owned by farmer G.M.Bailey,who mainly farms milking cows.Permission has been sought to build here also.
